result.execSummary:
The defendant Lonnell Detric Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample, pay the surcharge.
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supevision fees as determined by DOC.  Court found the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable.  Bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owig is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.

No violent contact with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant Lonnell Detric Johnson in court PRO SE.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 10 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs, signed and filed on 12-14-15.  Order forwarded to Clerk of Circuit Court for further processing.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lonnell Detric Johnson in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 15 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 3/25/16.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Lonnell Detric Johnson in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait who appeared via telephone.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Court in receipt of violation report from Justice Point.  Defendant tested positive for THC.  Argument heard as to bail.  Court admonished the defendant and advised him that any further positive tests may result in higher cash bail.

Defendant Lonnell Detric Johnson in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  The 11/18/15 jury trial is vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Lonnell Detric Johnson in court.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant informed the Court he does not have the funds to retain counsel.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Patrick Wait as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Wait accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11/01/15 until paid in full. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
